doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Create a distance matrix from a multiple sequence alignment

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.label:
Multiple substitution correction methods for nucleotides?
Uncorrected Jukes-cantor Kimura Tamura Tajima-nei Jin-nei gamma
Multiple substitution correction methods for nucleotides.

Multiple substitution correction methods for proteins?
Uncorrected Jukes-cantor Kimura protein
Multiple substitution correction methods for proteins.

Use the ambiguous codes in the calculation.?
Yes No
Option to use the ambiguous codes in the calculation of the Jukes-Cantor method or if the sequences are proteins.

Weight given to gaps?
Option to weight gaps in the uncorrected (nucleotide) and Jukes-Cantor distance methods.

Base position to analyse?
Choose base positions to analyse in each codon i.e. 123 (all bases), 12 (the first two bases), 1, 2, or 3 individual bases.

Calculate the nucleotide jin-nei parameter 'a'?
Yes No
This will force the calculation of parameter 'a' in the Jin-Nei Gamma distance calculation, otherwise the default is 1.0 (see -parametera option).

Nucleotide jin-nei parameter 'a'?
User defined parameter 'a' to be use in the Jin-Nei Gamma distance calculation. The suggested value to be used is 1.0 (Jin et al.) and this is the default.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Multiple substitution correction methods for nucleotides.
Multiple substitution correction methods for proteins.
Option to use the ambiguous codes in the calculation of the Jukes-Cantor method or if the sequences are proteins.
Option to weight gaps in the uncorrected (nucleotide) and Jukes-Cantor distance methods.
Choose base positions to analyse in each codon i.e. 123 (all bases), 12 (the first two bases), 1, 2, or 3 individual bases.
This will force the calculation of parameter 'a' in the Jin-Nei Gamma distance calculation, otherwise the default is 1.0 (see -parametera option).
User defined parameter 'a' to be use in the Jin-Nei Gamma distance calculation. The suggested value to be used is 1.0 (Jin et al.) and this is the default.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory

parameter.name: e_nucmethod
parameter.prompt: Multiple substitution correction methods for nucleotides

format.code: ("", " -nucmethod=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: Multiple substitution correction methods for nucleotides.

interface.label:
Multiple substitution correction methods for nucleotides?
Uncorrected Jukes-cantor Kimura Tamura Tajima-nei Jin-nei gamma
